schema.description:
Shuffle value on specific `dim`. 
Example: 
    Do BGR2RGB on NCHW format tensor: dim=1, shuffle = [2, 1, 0].

inputs.description: [device] compuating data, in NCHW(default) or NHWC format.
inputs.name: x

inputs.description: [device] Compuating data, in NCHW(default) or NHWC format.
inputs.name: x

schema.description: Return x if dims <= x.dims, else expanded x shape to has dims. First insert front of shape if `inverse` is false.

attributes.description: max dim can be add in front.
attributes.name: front

attributes.description: max dim can be add in end.
attributes.name: end

attributes.description: first add in front if inverse is false.
attributes.name: inverse

schema.description:
y = x if x.shape < `shape`, else center crop x.  
Note: If shape.size < x.dims, then expand -1 on the x's high dim. 
Example: 
    if x=float32[1, 3, 90, 90], shape=[-1, -1, 80, 80], got y=[1, 3, 80, 80].

inputs.description: [device] compuating data, in NCHW(default) or NHWC format.
inputs.name: x

schema.description: Center crop tensor from given NHWC format tensor.
Adjust image within letterbox, resize image and pad with outer_value.

attributes.description: resize image method, in [linear=0, cubic=1, nearest=2, hard=3].
attributes.name: type

attributes.description: outer value pad image after reiszed.
attributes.name: outer_value

schema.description: Equal scale or hard resize imagel. If size.size == 1, do equal scale image with long edge. If size.size == 2, do hard resize image.

attributes.description: resize image method, in [linear=0, cubic=1, nearest=2, hard=3].
attributes.name: type

attributes.description: dest shape, -1 for remaining unspecified dimensions, 0 for equal to input dim.
attributes.name: shape

inputs.description: [host] dest shape, -1 for remaining unspecified dimensions, 0 for equal to input dim.
inputs.name: shape

schema.description:
Resize tensor to given size, only 2d resize support. Output tensor has shape `size`. s
Note: $x.dims == $size.size. 
Example: 
    x=[1, 640, 480, 3], size=[-1, 300, 300, -1],

attributes.description: resize image method, in [linear=0, cubic=1, nearest=2, hard=3].
attributes.name: type

inputs.description: [device] compuating data, in NCHW(default) or NHWC format.
inputs.name: x

inputs.description: [device] Compuating data, in NCHW(default) or NHWC format.
inputs.name: x

schema.description: Transpose tenosr with `permute`, like y = numpy.transpose(x, permute)

Sample 2d data on x: $y([a, b]) = sample($x(affine * [a, b, 1])). 
`dim` and `dim + 1` mean image's dimensions.

attributes.description: resize image method, in [linear=0, cubic=1, nearest=2, hard=3].
attributes.name: type

attributes.description: sampled value if sample on the over area.
attributes.name: outer_value

schema.description: Get max indices in x on `dim`. Indices has dim = $x.dims - 1, shape like [x.shape(0), ..., x.shape(dim - 1), x.shape(dim + 1), ...]

Rearranges (permutes) data from batch into blocks of spatial data, followed by cropping. Only support NCHW format. 
 See tf.[BatchToSapceND](https://www.w3cschool.cn/tensorflow_python/tensorflow_python-bnyg2ckl.html) for more information.
Broadcast x to shape, assume like x * numpy.ones(shape).
Inverse operation of concat. Assume like y = numpy.split(x, chunks, dim).

inputs.description: [device] compuating data, in NCHW(default) or NHWC format.
inputs.name: x

attributes.description: how to dequantize after convolution. dequantize_scales.size == w.shape(0)

schema.description: Adjust input x' shape to witch can be divide exactly.

attributes.description: padding value when pad input tensor.

schema.description: Force convert input data to color mode. Assume that channel is last dim.
Force convert input data to gray mode. Assume that channel is last dim.

attributes.description: How to convert color format to gray, y = [b, g, r] * scale. [0.114, 0.587, 0.299] is for bgr2gray.
attributes.name: scale

schema.description: y = batch_scale(batch_norm(x, mean, variance), scale, bias)

Index the last axis (if indices.shape[-1] == x.rank) or slice (indices.shape[-1] < x.rank) according to the indices.shape[-1]. 
Output Shape indices.shape[:-1] + x.shape[indices.shape[-1]:].
Do gemm(transA, transB, M, N, K, alpha, a, _, b, _, beta, C, _).

examples.code:
A' = transpose(A) if transA else A
B' = transpose(B) if transB else B
Compute Y = alpha * A' * B' + beta * C,
where input tensor A has shape (M, K) or (K, M),
input tensor B has shape (K, N) or (N, K),
input tensor C is broadcastable to shape (M, N),
and output tensor Y has shape (M, N).
A will be transposed before doing the computation
if attribute transA is non-zero, same for B and transB.
This operator supports unidirectional broadcasting
(tensor C should be unidirectional broadcastable
to tensor A * B);

inputs.description: [device] Compuating data, in NCHW(default) or NHWC format.
inputs.name: x

schema.description:
Do L2 norm on `dim` axis. 
For 1-D NDArray, it computes: out = data / sqrt(sum(data ** 2) + eps). 
 For N-D NDArray, if the input array has shape (N, N, ..., N): 
for dim in 2...N 
for i in 0...N 
out[.....,i,...] = take(out, indices=i, axis=dim) / sqrt(sum(take(out, indices=i, axis=dim) ** 2) + eps)
Got max value of x on `dim` axis.

attributes.description: if retain reduced dimensions with length 1.
attributes.name: keep_dims

attributes.description: min overlap area to select bbox to fuse.
attributes.name: iou_threshold

attributes.description: threshold for deciding when to remove boxes based on score.
attributes.name: score_threshold

schema.description: Norm image with mean and std_dev. For each $x_i$ of n-th image run：$x_i = (x_i - mean(x_i)) / (std_dev(x_i) + epsilon)$.

inputs.description: [device] first axes represent value has N images.
inputs.name: x

schema.description: Pad `padding_value` on input tensor. Support neg `padding` for crop tensor.

attributes.name: padding_type
